English:
Ah! You! You're the guy from the detective agency,
right? You're the one they sent as a babysitter?
All right then, get over here!
Chinese:
啊！你是偵探事務所的人嗎！
你接下顧小孩的委託案了對吧，
那就拜託你囉！
Korean:
아! 너, 탐정사무소 녀석인가!
애보기 의뢰를 받아줬구나
그럼, 바로 부탁할게!
German:
Ach, du! Du kommst doch vom Detektivbüro, nicht
wahr? Du sollst der Babysitter sein?
Na schön, komm mal her!

English:
...Suppose I should've said, I'm the one you're
babysitting.
Chinese:
奇怪，我之前沒有說嗎？
那個要顧的小孩就是我。
Korean:
……어라, 말하지 않았었나?
돌볼 상대가 나라는 거
German:
Vielleicht hätte ich es sagen sollen.
Ich selbst brauche den Babysitter.

English:
There's another Digimon that always takes care of
me, but he's out today.
Chinese:
平常都會有一隻數碼寶貝照顧我，
但它今天正好出門了不在家。
Korean:
언제나 돌봐주는 디지몬이 있지만 말야
뭐, 좀 어딜 가서 오늘은 없거든
German:
Normalerweise kümmert sich sonst ein anderes
Digimon um mich, aber heute ist es nicht da.

English:
Today you're gonna do it instead!
Sooooo, let's play!
Chinese:
所以今天你要代替它！
就是這樣，快點陪我玩吧！
Korean:
그래서 오늘은 네가 그 대신이라는 거지!
그러니까 나랑 놀아줘!
German:
Stattdessen bist du heute da!
Also, spielen wir!

English:
Let's play sumo.
Let's play house.
Let's play with blocks.
Chinese:
玩相撲。
玩家家酒。
玩積木。
Korean:
스모를 한다
소꿉놀이를 한다
블록 놀이를 한다
German:
Spielen wir Sumo.
Spielen wir Vater, Mutter, Kind.
Spielen wir mit Blöcken.

English:
If she keeps not eating like this I'm sure she
will faint! So, I was thinking of making her some
of her favorite ramen.
Chinese:
如果一直像這樣什麼都不吃她會病倒的，
那可就大事不妙了。
所以我想煮一碗主人喜歡的拉麵給她吃。
Korean:
이대로 아무것도 드시지 않다가 쓰러지기라도 하면 큰일이잖아?
그러니까 주인님이 좋아하는 라면을
만들어 드리려고 해
German:
Wenn sie weiterhin nichts isst, wird sie sicher
ohnmächtig! Deshalb habe ich überlegt,
ihre Lieblingsramen zu kochen.

English:
Sumo? Awesome!
Let's do it! Let's do it!
Chinese:
相撲？　聽起來不錯！
我們快點來玩吧！
Korean:
스모? 좋네!
바로 하자고!
German:
Sumo? Toll!
Los geht’s!

English:
Right, forget the rules.
You can even use Digimon if you wanna!
Chinese:
那規則就不限制了，
你也可以把數碼寶貝叫出來。
Korean:
그럼 룰은 뭐든 되는 걸로 하자
너도 디지몬 꺼내도 돼
German:
Ach, vergiss die Regeln.
Wenn du möchtest, kannst du auch Digimon benutzen!

English:
...Huh? It's just a Digimon fight?
I don't mind, sure!
Chinese:
嗯？　這樣就只是數碼寶貝在比賽而已？
唉唷沒關係啦！
Korean:
……앙? 그러면 단순한 디지몬 승부라고?
상관없어― 상관없다니까!
German:
Was? Das ist bloß ein Digimonkampf?
Das ist mir egal!

English: Alright, here I come!
Chinese: 那我要上囉！
Korean: 그럼, 간다!!
German: Also gut, hier komme ich!

English:
Did you say "play house"!?
Stop treating me like a child!
I'm not a little kid, you know!
Chinese:
家家酒！？
你把我當小孩子嗎！？
我沒有那麼小好不好！
Korean:
소꿉놀이라구―!?
너, 나를 애 취급하고 있지!?
난 그렇게까진 애가 아니야!
German:
Hast du „Vater, Mutter, Kind“ gesagt?!
Hör auf, mich wie ein Kind zu behandeln!
Ich bin doch kein kleines Kind!

English:
I know...
Let's do something a bit more active!
Chinese:
該怎麼說呢……
我想玩那種可以盡情活動身體的遊戲。
Korean:
뭐랄까, 그…
좀 더 잔뜩 몸을 움직이는 놀이를 하고 싶은 거라고
German:
Ich weiß ...
Spielen wir was mit mehr Action!

English:
...Oh! I've got an idea!
I can fight your Digimon!
Chinese:
啊！　我想到一個好主意了！
我要和你的數碼寶貝對戰！
Korean:
……오! 좋은 게 생각났어!
네 디지몬이랑 배틀이다―!
German:
Ach! Ich habe eine Idee!
Ich kann gegen deine Digimon kämpfen!

English:
Play blocks?
Don't we need to get ToyAgumon for that?
Chinese:
玩積木？
那不就要把積木亞古獸叫來了嗎？
Korean:
블록 놀이라고?
그걸 하려면 토이아구몬을 불러야 하는 거 아냐?
German:
Mit Blöcken spielen?
Brauchen wir dafür nicht ein ToyAgumon?

English:
...What?
We can play blocks without ToyAgumon?
Chinese:
什麼？　只要有玩具積木，
不用叫積木亞古獸來也可以玩？
Korean:
……뭐? 장난감 블록이 있으면
토이아구몬을 부르지 않아도 놀 수 있다고?
German:
... Was?
Wir können ohne ToyAgumon mit Blöcken spielen?

English:
THAT's what it is!? You mean "play blocks" doesn't
just mean when I scare ToyAgumon and watch him
drop his blocks everywhere and laugh at him?
Chinese:
是這樣嗎！？
原來「玩積木」不是嚇積木亞古獸一跳，
看它散成一塊一塊的遊戲啊……
Korean:
그랬어!?
「블록 놀이」라는 건 토이아구몬을 놀라게 해서
뿔뿔이 흩어진 걸 보고 즐기는 게 아니었던 건가…
German:
DAS meinst du? Du meinst nicht, dass ich ToyAgumon
Angst mache, er überall seine Blöcke fallen lässt
und ich ihn dann auslache?

English:
Hmm, nah. If that's what it is, we should play
something else.
Chinese:
算了，沒關係。
既然這樣，我們就來玩別的遊戲。
Korean:
뭐, 그건 됐어
이렇게 된 이상 다른 놀이를 즐기자구
German:
Hm, nee. Wenn du das meinst, sollten wir was
anderes spielen.

English: ...So, how about I fight your Digimon?
Chinese: 所以叫出你的數碼寶貝跟我對戰吧！
Korean: 그러니까, 네 디지몬이랑 배틀이다―!
German:
Wie wäre es, wenn ich gegen deine Digimon
kämpfe?

English:
Damn... I lost!
I can't move a muscle...
Chinese:
不行了～我認輸！
我再也動不了了。
Korean:
안되겠다아― 졌어!
더 이상 몸이 안 움직여
German:
Mist ... Ich habe verloren!
Ich kann keinen Muskel bewegen ...

English:
I hate losing, but that sure was fun! Okay, I'll
take a short break and then it's on to round 2!
Chinese:
雖然我討厭輸，但是感覺好好玩喔！
我們休息一下，再來打第2回合吧！
Korean:
지는 건 싫지만, 왠지 모르게 즐거웠네!
있지, 조금 쉰 후에 제2라운드 시작하자!
German:
Ich hasse es zwar zu verlieren, aber das hat Spaß
gemacht! Ich mache kurz Pause und dann
geht es in die zweite Runde!

English: ...Impmon!
Chinese: ……小妖獸！
Korean: ……임프몬!
German: ... Impmon!

English: ...Huh? That...that voice...
Chinese: ……嗯？　這個聲音是……
Korean: ……응? 이 목소리는…
German: ... Was? Diese ... Diese Stimme ...

English:
Gah, Cyberdramon!
This is the Digimon that takes care of me...
Chinese:
呃，電子龍獸！！
……就是它啦，平常照顧我的那個數碼寶貝。
Korean:
으엑, 사이버드라몬!!
…날 돌봐주는 디지몬이 이 녀석이야
German:
Ach, Cyberdramon!
Das ist das Digimon, das sich um mich kümmert ...

English: Hey jerk, what're you doing!?
Chinese: 你在做什麼！！
Korean: 너, 뭐하고 있는 거야!!
German: Hey, Knallkopf, was machst du denn?!

English: No! No! We were just playing...
Chinese: 沒有啊，我只是和這個人玩一下……
Korean: 아니, 이 사람이랑 좀 놀고 있었더니 말야―…
German: Nein! Nein! Wir haben bloß gespielt!

English:
Shut up, Impmon! I was talking to this jerk here!
So, you waited until I wasn't home to try and take
Impmon away!?
Chinese:
小妖獸你閉嘴！　我是在問那邊那個人！
你想趁我不在的時候把小妖獸帶走嗎？
Korean:
임프몬은 조용히 해! 볼일이 있는 건 거기 있는 너다!
내가 자리를 비운 틈을 노리고 임프몬을 데려가려는 속셈이었나!?
German:
Sei still, Impmon! Ich rede mit dem Knallkopf
da! Du wartest also, bis ich weg bin, um zu
versuchen, Impmon mitzunehmen?

English:
Tha'...that's right Cyberdramon!
This guy was trying to kidnap me!
Chinese:
沒、沒錯，電子龍獸！
這傢伙想要綁架我～
Korean:
마, 맞아, 사이버드라몬!
이 녀석 날 납치하려고 했어―
German:
Das ... Genau, Cyberdramon!
Dieser Mensch hat versucht, mich zu entführen!

English: What!? There's no way I'm gonna let you do that!
Chinese: 什麼！？　不可原諒！！
Korean: 뭐라고!? 너, 용서하지 않겠다!!
German: Was?! Das lasse ich auf keinen Fall zu!

English: Wha'...? stay away! Don't touch Impmon!
Chinese:
唔，住手……！
不准對小妖獸出手……！！
Korean:
큭, 그만둬…!
임프몬에겐 손대지 마…!!
German: Was? Bleib weg! Fass Impmon nicht an!

English:
...Huh? You didn't come here to kidnap Impmon?
You're his babysitter?
What do you mean?
Chinese:
什麼？　你不是來綁架小妖獸，
而是來看顧它的？
到底怎麼一回事？
Korean:
……하? 너는 납치하러 온 게 아니라
임프몬을 돌봐주러 왔다고?
그건 무슨 말이지?
German:
Was? Du bist nicht hier, um Impmon zu
entführen? Du bist sein Babysitter?
Was soll das heißen?

English: So...Impmon hired you?
Chinese: 原來如此，小妖獸擅自發出了委託啊。
Korean: ……그렇군, 임프몬이 멋대로 의뢰를 한 건가
German: Impmon hat dich also ... angeheuert?

English:
Ahhahahahaha!
Got you, Cyberdramon!
Did you really think he was trying to kidnap me!?
Chinese:
哈哈哈哈哈！
笑死我了電子龍獸！
你還真的相信他是來綁架我！！
Korean:
아하하하하!
사이버드라몬, 재밌네!
정말 납치하려 했다고 믿는 거야!!
German:
Hahaha!
Reingelegt, Cyberdramon!
Dachtest du echt, ich werde entführt?!

English: ...Ouch!
Chinese: 好痛！
Korean: ……아얏!
German: Autsch!

English: You were the one lying to me!?
Chinese: 你騙我的嗎！
Korean: 나한테 거짓말을 한 건 너냐!
German: Du hast mich angelogen?!

English:
Sorry! Sorry!
It just sort of started to go that way
and I thought it was funny...sorry.
Chinese:
對不起啦，
我是覺得這樣講之後好像會很有趣……所以就……
Korean:
미안, 미안
조금 재미있는 전개가 될 것 같길래… 그만
German:
Es tut mir leid! Es hat sich einfach so
ergeben und ich fand es lustig.
Tut mir leid.

English:
Ugh, see how you've messed everything up by
kidding around!?
Chinese:
還不是因為你亂開玩笑，
給人家也造成麻煩了！
Korean:
네가 실없는 짓을 하니까
이 분에게도 폐를 끼쳐버렸잖아!
German:
Argh, siehst du, was du mit deinen Späßen
angerichtet hast?

English: I'm really sorry about the misunderstanding...
Chinese: 是我會錯意，真的很對不起。
Korean: 오해해서 정말 미안했다
German: Dieses Missverständnis tut mir wirklich leid ...

English: Ahahaha! Cyberdramon is apologizing!
Chinese:
哈哈哈哈哈！
那個電子龍獸居然低頭道歉！
Korean:
아하하하하!
그 사이버드라몬이 머리 숙이고 사과하고 있어―!
German: Hahaha! Cyberdramon entschuldigt sich!

English: ...Ouch!
Chinese: 好痛！
Korean: ……아얏!
German: Autsch!

English: And you're gonna apologize too!
Chinese: 你也給我好好道歉。
Korean: 너도 제대로 사과해
German: Und du wirst dich auch entschuldigen!

English: Sooorry....
Chinese: 對不起……
Korean: 죄송합니다―…
German: Tut mir leeeid ...

English: But I hired this guy so you could have a rest.
Chinese:
可是，我是因為想讓電子龍獸休息，
才委託這傢伙來看顧我的！
Korean:
하지만 나, 사이버드라몬을 쉬게 하고 싶어서
이 녀석에게 돌보기 의뢰를 했다고!
German:
Aber ich habe den Menschen angeheuert, damit du
dich ausruhen kannst.

English:
You're always taking care of me and it's gotta be
exhausting, so...I thought you should take a break
every once in a while.
Chinese:
電子龍獸每天都要照顧我，感覺好像很辛苦……
所以我才希望你偶爾也可以休息一下！
Korean:
사이버드라몬은 언제나 나를 돌봐주느라
바빠 보였으니까… 가끔은 좀 쉬었으면 했어!
German:
Immer kümmerst du dich um mich, das muss
anstrengend sein. Ich dachte, du könntest
mal eine Pause gebrauchen.

English: Impmon...
Chinese: 小妖獸……
Korean: 임프몬…
German: Impmon ...

English: Hehe...
Chinese: 嘿嘿……
Korean: 에헤헤…
German: Hihi ...

English: Ouch! Why do you keep hitting me!?
Chinese:
好痛！
為什麼要揍我啊！！
Korean:
……아얏!
잠깐, 왜 그 대목에서 때리는 거야―!!
German: Autsch! Warum haust du mich ständig?!

English:
Don't you think it's a bit rude to refer to the
person who came here just for you as "this guy"!?
Chinese:
人家為了你過來，
不准用「這傢伙」這種沒禮貌的稱呼亂叫人家！！
Korean:
너를 위해 와 준 분에게
「이 녀석」같은 실례되는 말을 하는 거 아니야!!
German:
Findest du es nicht unhöflich, die Person, die
bloß wegen dir herkam, als „den Menschen“
zu bezeichnen?!

English: Oh, yeah... Sooorry!
Chinese: 嗚嗚……對不起……
Korean: 으으… 죄송합니다―…
German: Ach ja ... Tut mir leeeid!

English:
Thank you for coming to play with Impmon.
I will take over from here on.
Chinese:
謝謝你陪小妖獸玩。
之後會由我來看好它的，所以不用擔心。
Korean:
임프몬의 놀이에 어울려줘서 고마워
이제부터는 내가 언제나처럼 돌볼 테니까, 이제 괜찮아
German:
Danke, dass du gekommen bist, um mit Impmon zu
spielen. Ich übernehme jetzt wieder.

English:
Awww, but I wanted to play some more!
Okay, let's play again some time!
Chinese:
嘖，我還想再玩一下呢～
那我們下次再一起玩吧！
Korean:
쳇, 좀 더 놀고 싶었는데 말이야―
그럼, 다음에 또 놀자!
German:
Ach, aber ich wollte noch ein bisschen spielen!
Na gut, spielen wir bald noch mal!

English:
So, could you come back and play with me again
sometime?
Chinese: 你會再跟我一起玩吧！？
Korean: 있지, 또 나랑 놀아줄래!?
German: Kannst du wiederkommen und mit mir spielen?

English:
Well, I guess it's kind of touching that he cares
about me. I can't stay angry at him. That's how it
is when you're a doting parent, I suppose.
Chinese:
不過，一聽到它說是為了我，
我就生氣不起來了……
這就是所謂的溺愛嗎？
Korean:
그나저나, 날 위해서라고 하면 약해지네
화내려고 해도 화낼 수 없어질 것 같아
이게 팔불출이라는 건가?
German:
Irgendwie ist es ja rührend, dass er sich um mich
sorgt. Ich kann ihm nicht böse sein. So ist es
eben, wenn man sein Kind abgöttisch liebt.
